diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Disseminated Mycobacterium genavense infection due to an underlying inborn error of interferon-Î³ immunity.
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Lymphoma, disseminated mycobacterial disease (M. tuberculosis or nontuberculous mycobacterium), and immunodeficiency syndromes.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The child presented with pneumonia lasting over 4 months despite treatment and showed multi-organ involvement (lungs, spleen, lymph nodes). Findings such as acid-fast bacilli in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid, maternal history of BCG disease, and a positive tuberculin skin test contributed to the suspicion of mycobacterial disease. Detection of M. genavense in the child and strong suspicion of an underlying immunodeficiency led to the diagnosis.
